intro: Draba boyacana, commonly known as the Boyacá whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of Colombia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
